page.title: 08Maltby Model Village
page.content: The Model Village was built to house the workers at Maltby pit. Its circular plan is derived from the garden city movement. The brick houses once ringed a round green called the bandstand,but this has now been redeveloped with bungalows for the elderly. I like living in the Model Village because the air is clean and it is near the country. There are grassy play areas,but it is safer to play on the road because of tins,glass and the nuisance of dogs. People in the Model Village should train their pets and stop them roaming around. On the back streets there are hardly any lights and it is not safe to go out at night. Nearby is Crags School and the Church of the Ascension. Many miners still live in the Model Village, but many have bought their own homes.
